column3: Card Text to Display

At the beginning of your upkeep, you may say "Ach! Hans, run! It's the . . ." and name a creature card. If you do, search your library for the named card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library. That creature has haste. Exile it at end of turn.
1: Target permanent you control's name becomes the name of your choice. Play this effect anywhere, anytime as long as this effect is in play.
X1B: Discard X cards. Look at target opponent's hand and choose X cards from it. That player discards those cards. Play this effect as a sorcery.
Tap and sacrifice a land you control: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
At the beginning of your upkeep, create a 3/4 white Gargoyle creature token with flying and protection from red.
Creatures get +0/+3.

2UU: Untap target creature. You control that creature. When that creature is put into a graveyard or this effect leaves play, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control. Play this effect as a sorcery.
Instants, sorceries, or activated abilities that aren't mana abilities may not be played.
U, Sacrifice a blue permanent: Counter target spell.
1WW or discard a Plains card: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Whenever a creature blocks or becomes blocked by a green or white creature, destroy the green and white creature(s) at end of combat.

Tap an untapped creature you control: Tap target permanent. UUU: Tap all creatures without flying.
Creatures you control have flying during your turn. Threshold - Creatures you control also have shroud during your turn.

Creatures have protection from red.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control or a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.
WUU: Counter target spell. You gain 3 life.
Whenever a creature dies, destroy all creatures blocking or blocked by it. They can't be regenerated.
3W: Choose one - You gain 5 life; or prevent the next 5 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. Entwine 2 (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

If you would draw a card, you may instead choose land or nonland and reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a card of the chosen kind. Put that card into your hand and put all other cards revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.
Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, each player exiles a creature.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, target player discards two cards.
B, Tap an untapped creature you control: Tap target creature. Chaos deals damage equal to the power of your tapped creature to the other creature. Play this effect only once per turn.
Whenever a creature attacks and isn't blocked, the defending player discards a card.
Whenever a player discards a card, creatures controlled by the active player get +2/+2 and gain fear until end of turn.
Whenever a creature deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.

Whenever a creature you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may exile it. If you do, search your library for an enchantment card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may put an Aura card from your hand onto the battlefield attached to that creature.
1U, Tap a land you control: Put target artifact card in your graveyard on top of your library. Play this effect only once per turn.
Creatures have haste.
3GG: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the highest converted mana cost among permanents you control.
3R, Discard a card at random: Chaos deals 5 damage to target creature. Play this effect as a sorcery.
1U: Draw a card, then draw 1d3-1 cards.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, sacrifice a creature.
3U: Destroy all Forests. Play this effect as a sorcery.
Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a non-Wall creature, destroy that non-Wall creature. Whenever a creature you control leaves the battlefield, sacrifice a permanent.
2, Sacrifice a creature: It deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
2R: Chaos deals damage to each player equal to the number of lands he or she controls. Play this effect as a sorcery.

During your turn, your creatures have power and toughness each equal to the number of cards in the hand of the opponent with the most cards in hand.
1: Target creature gets +0/+1 this turn.
Tap an untapped creature you control: Add either U or 1U to your mana pool. Play this effect only once per turn.

Creatures you control have flying and vigilance during your turn. Tap an untapped creature you control: When target creature other than the creature you tapped is put into a graveyard, return that card to the battlefield. Play this effect only during your turn.
1(S): Target creature loses flying until end of turn. (S) can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, clash with an opponent. If you win, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
1B: Choose a color. Target player reveals his or her hand, then you choose a card of that color from it. That player discards that card. Play this effect as a sorcery.

1: The next time an instant or sorcery spell would deal damage to you this turn, that spell deals that damage to its controller instead.
1, Tap an untapped permanent you control: Target 1/1 creature gets +1/+2 this turn.
1, Tap and sacrifice a permanent: Chaos deals 2 damage to target creature or player. Play this effect as a sorcery and only once per turn.

Creatures have power and toughness each equal to the number of cards in their controllers hands. Whenever a time counter is removed from a suspended card while it's removed from the game, its controller draws a card.

At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal a card at random from your hand. If you reveal a noncreature card this way, discard that card. If you reveal a creature card this way, put that card onto the battlefield unless any player pays 5 life. If a player pays 5 life, discard that card.

At the beginning of your upkeep, put a Chaos counter onto the battlefield. When this effect leaves play, exile all Chaos counters.
If its not your turn, your creatures get +1/+1, have reach, and can block creatures with shadow as though they didn't have shadow.

Whenever a creature you control blocks a creature, you may return your blocker to its owner's hand. If you do, you may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield blocking that creature.

When this effect comes into play, each player gets three Chaos counters. At the beginning of your upkeep, put one of your Chaos counters on a creature you control and it becomes a +1/+1 counter. When you have no more Chaos counters, sacrifice a permanent. When this effect leaves play exile all Chaos counters.

Take 3 damage: Destroy target artifact, creature, or land. Play this effect as a sorcery.

Attach all creatures you control on the battlefield in pairs of two. These creatures are treated as one big creature that keeps all abilities of both creatures, has power and toughness equal to the sum of each creature, and can only be blocked by three or more creatures. Singular creatures are not creatures until they have another creature attached to them. If one half of the pair leaves play, the other half is sacrificed. When this effect leaves play, unattach all creatures.

While doing so, the player can activate mana abilities only if they’re from lands that player controls and only if mana they produce is spent to activate other mana abilities of lands the player controls and/or to play that card. If the chosen card is cast as a spell, you control the player while that spell is resolving.
U: Return target creature and all white Auras you own attached to it to their owners' hands.
G: Search your library for a creature card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the revealed card back on top of it.

Players can't play lands. If a land would enter the battlefield, instead it doesn't. At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice two lands or pay 5 life. If you do, you may disregard this effect for your turn.
GG: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn and deals 2 damage to you. BB: Target creature gains swampwalk until end of turn and deals 2 damage to you.
If you control a creature, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.

Players play with their hands revealed. If you would draw a card, reveal it instead. Then any other player may pay 2 life. If a player does, put that card into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, draw a card.
